summary: This bill, the Stop Arctic Ocean Drilling Act of 2025 (H.R. 2848), aims to prohibit oil and gas leasing in the Arctic areas of the Outer Continental Shelf. It amends the Outer Continental Shelf Lands Act, specifically Section 8, to prevent the Secretary of the Interior from issuing or extending leases or authorizations for any mineral exploration, development, or production in these designated Arctic areas. The bill references the definition of 'Arctic' as outlined in the Arctic Research and Policy Act of 1984.
